(football)|Fenerbahçe]] (on loan from [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]]) | clubnumber = 31 | clubs1 = [[JSM Chéraga]] | years1 = 2008–2009 | caps1 = 38 | goals1 = 19 | clubs2 = [[CR Belouizdad]] | years2 = 2009–2013 | caps2 = 98 | goals2 = 32 | years3 = 2013–2016 | clubs3 = [[Sporting Clube de Portugal|Sporting CP]] | caps3 = 82 | goals3 = 48 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] | caps4 = 35 | goals4 = 8 | years5 = 2018 | clubs5 = → [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] (loan) | caps5 = 4 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = → [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] (loan) | caps6 = 14 | goals6 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2012– | nationalteam1 = [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] | nationalcaps1 = 59 | nationalgoals1 = 27 | nationalteam2 = [[Algeria A' national football team|Algeria A']] | nationalyears2 = 2013 | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | club-update = 13 February 2019 | nationalteam-update = 20:56, 8 September 2018 (UTC) }} '''Islam Slimani''' ({{lang-ar|إسلام سليماني}}; born 18 June 1988) is an Algerian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for [[Süper Lig]] club [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] on loan from [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] and for the [[Algeria national football team|Algeria national team]].
Slimani began his career in his homeland with [[JSM Chéraga]] and [[CR Belouizdad]]. In 2013 he moved to Europe, signing for [[Sporting CP]]. He played and scored regularly during his three seasons in Portugal, helping his team win the [[Taça de Portugal]] in 2015. In 2016, Slimani transferred to Leicester for a club record £28 million fee.
An Algerian international, Slimani made his international debut in 2012 and played at the [[Africa Cup of Nations]] in [[2013 Africa Cup of Nations|2013]] and the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations|2015]]. He was also part of Algeria's squad at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], where he finished as the team's joint top scorer with two goals. As of January 2017, he has won 49 international [[cap (sport)|caps]] and scored 25 goals, making him Algeria's fourth highest all-time goalscorer.
==Club career== [[File:SlimaniCRBelouizdad.png|left|thumb|200px|Slimani playing for [[CR Belouizdad]] in 2012]]
===Early career=== In May 2009, Slimani joined [[CR Belouizdad]] from [[JSM Chéraga]] for a transfer fee of 800,000 [[Algerian dinar]]s,<ref name="gbio">{{cite web|last1=Hassani|first1=Kamal|title=World Cup 2014: Algeria profile – Islam Slimani|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jun/06/world-cup-2014-ageria-islam-slimani|work=The Guardian|accessdate=21 July 2014|date=31 May 2014}}</ref> signing a two-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bordj.info/spip.php?breve1566|title=Finale de la coupe d'Algérie : le CR Belouizdad à pied d'œuvre|author=KY|publisher=El Watan|date=17 May 2009|accessdate=8 January 2013|language=French|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120730030501/http://www.bordj.info/spip.php?breve1566|archive-date=30 July 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In August, he made his official debut for the club as a starter against [[MC Oran]] in the first week of the [[2009–10 Algerian Championnat National]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/fiches/fiche2.php?fiche_id=4638|title=Division 1 1e j MCO 4–1 CRB|publisher=DZFoot|accessdate=8 January 2013}}</ref> He finished his first season with Belouizdad with 8 goals in 30 games.
On 17 May 2011, Slimani scored four goals in a league game against [[JS Kabylie]], leading CR Belouizdad to an impressive 7–1 win.<ref>[http://www.tsa-algerie.com/sport/ligue-1-ecrasante-et-historique-victoire-du-cr-belouizdad-sur-la-js-kabylie-7-1_15701.html Ligue 1 : écrasante et historique victoire du CR Belouizdad sur la JS Kabylie (7–1)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110521040905/http://www.tsa-algerie.com/sport/ligue-1-ecrasante-et-historique-victoire-du-cr-belouizdad-sur-la-js-kabylie-7-1_15701.html |date=21 May 2011 }}</ref> In July 2011, with his contract expired and several French clubs such as [[OGC Nice|Nice]] and [[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]] showing interest in signing him, Slimani decided to sign a two-year extension with CR Belouizdad.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/news-11840-l1-islam-slimani-prolonge-au-cr-belouizdad.php|title=Islam Slimani prolonge au CR Belouizdad|publisher=DZFoot|language=French|date=13 July 2012|accessdate=8 January 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120914011632/http://www.dzfoot.com/news-11840-l1-islam-slimani-prolonge-au-cr-belouizdad.php|archivedate=14 September 2012|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Sporting CP=== [[File:Chelsea-SportLisb (4) - копия.jpg|right|thumb|160px|Slimani with [[Sporting CP]] in 2014]]
On 6 August 2013, Slimani joined [[Sporting CP]] for an undisclosed fee.<ref name="gbio" /> He started the [[2013–14 Sporting Clube de Portugal season|2013–14 season]] as a substitute, gaining a reputation as an impact player due to him scoring vital goals when coming off the bench.<ref name="gbio" /> Due to the lack of form of [[Fredy Montero]], however, Slimani became a starter and scored four goals in four matches in early March 2014 against [[Rio Ave F.C.|Rio Ave]], [[S.C. Braga|Braga]], [[Vitória F.C.|Vitória de Setúbal]] and in 1–0 over [[FC Porto–Sporting CP rivalry|rivals]] [[FC Porto|Porto]].<ref name="gbio" /> In December 2013 he was considered the best Algerian footballer of the year as he won the Algerian Golden Ball.
In his second season Slimani was successful as he became a key player. His first goal of the season was in the [[Derby de Lisboa]] 1–1 away draw to [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Slimani buteur contre Benfica !|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2014/08/31/slimani-buteur-contre-benfica-50651.php|website=dzfoot.com|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref> At European level Slimani scored his first goal against [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] at [[Estádio José Alvalade]] in the last minute to finish 4–2<ref>{{cite web|title=LdC : Drôle de première pour Slimani !|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2014/11/05/ldc-drole-de-premiere-pour-slimani-55666.php|website=dzfoot.com|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref> for Sporting. At the end of the season he finished third in the league, but in the Taça de Portugal he reached the [[2015 Taça de Portugal Final|final]] against [[S.C. Braga|Braga]] on 31 May 2015, slimani scored a goal helping Sporting turn around a two-goal deficit to eventually secure the [[Taça de Portugal|cup]] following a penalty shootout 3–1.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Piedade|first1=Luis|title=Sporting dig deep to claim Portuguese Cup|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=por/news/newsid=2252986.html|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=16 August 2016|date=31 May 2015}}</ref> where he achieved his first title in his history at the end of the season Slimani played 33 games and scored 15 goals, including 12 in the league.
In the [[2015–16 Sporting Clube de Portugal season|2015–16 season]], Slimani said he would be his last season and aspires to achieve the title of the Primeira Liga absent for 14 years the new and former Benfica coach [[Jorge Jesus]], who said he would rely heavily on Slimani to win the titles and the start was in the [[2015 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira|Supertaça]] against Benfica and ended for Sporting with a single goal, achieving his second title.<ref>{{cite web|title=Slimani gagne la Super coupe contre Benfica|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2015/08/09/slimani-gagne-la-super-coupe-contre-benfica-72734.php|website=dzfoot.com|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref> At the start of the tournament, Slimani scored his first goal against [[Associação Académica de Coimbra – O.A.F.|Académica]] in an away match on 4 October 2015, and in the seventh round against [[Vitória S.C.|Vitória de Guimarães]], he scored his first [[List of Primeira Liga hat-tricks|hat-trick]] in the Portuguese league.<ref>{{cite web|title=Slimani : Hat-trick face au Vitoria Guimaraes|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2015/10/04/slimani-hat-trik-face-au-v-guimaraes-75166.php|website=dzfoot.com|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sporting 5–1 V. Guimarães|url=https://www.rtp.pt/noticias/desporto/slimani-lidera-a-armada-leonina-frente-ao-vitoria_e863460|website=rtp.pt|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref> At the top of the 15th round, Slimani managed to score two goals against Porto's goalkeeper [[Iker Casillas]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Sporting-Porto 2–0, Porto abandonne la tête du championnat au Sporting Portugal|url=http://www.goal.com/fr/match/sporting-cp-vs-fc-porto/2068462/report|website=goal|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Slimani claque un doublé retentissant face à Porto (2–0) !|url=http://lagazettedufennec.com/filinfo/portugal-slimani-claque-un-double-retentissant-face-a-porto-2-0/|website=lagazettedufennec|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref> to lead the team back to the top of the league. After this game, Slimani scored in four consecutive games 6 goals against [[Vitória F.C.|Vitória de Setúbal]], [[S.C. Braga|Braga]], [[C.D. Tondela|Tondela]] and [[F.C. Paços de Ferreira|Paços de Ferreira]]. After two matches, he returned to score twice at [[C.D. Nacional|Nacional]].
Before Sporting's league derby match at home, Benfica lodged a complaint against Slimani for assaulting [[Andreas Samaris]] with his elbow in a Portuguese Cup match on 21 November 2015.<ref>{{cite news|date=8 April 2016|title=Agressão de Slimani sem castigo|trans-title=Slimani's assault without punishment|url=http://relvado.aeiou.pt/sporting/agressao-slimani-sem-castigo-515530|language=pt|work=Relvado|access-date=24 June 2018}}</ref> After a long wait and one day before the match, the Portuguese League announced that Slimani could participate in the decisive match for the title.<ref>{{cite web|title=Portugal : Sporting – Benfica, Slimani en vedette|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2016/03/04/portugal-sporting-benfica-slimani-en-vedette-82414.php|website=dzfoot.com|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref> However, the team lost 1–0 and dropped to second place, behind Benfica. One week later, he scored his 20th goal this season in the match against [[G.D. Estoril Praia|Estoril]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Portugal : Chef d'oeuvre et 20e but de Slimani|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2016/03/12/portugal-le-but-de-grande-classe-de-slimani-82795.php|website=dzfoot.com|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref> After this meeting, he scored four goals against [[C.F. Os Belenenses|Belenenses]], [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]] and [[Moreirense F.C.|Moreirense]], and Porto. Slimani contributed to the victory at [[Estádio do Dragão]] after scoring two goals.<ref>{{cite web|title=Portugal : Doublé de Slimani dans le classico|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2016/04/30/portugal-double-de-slimani-dans-le-clasiico-85471.php|website=dzfoot.com|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref> In the final round, he scored the 27 goals against [[S.C. Braga|Braga]]. The match ended 4–0 but was not enough for Sporting to win the league title, as Benfica ended with more two points. That season, Slimani scored 27 goals in the league but finished behind top scorer [[Jonas Gonçalves Oliveira|Jonas]], with 32 goals.
For the following season, Sporting wanted to retain Slimani but he insisted on leaving the club, and that was finally accepted by the administration. On 28 August 2016, he played his last match against Porto at Estádio José Alvalade and scored his last goal to finish 2–1 for Sporting.<ref>{{cite web|title=Portugal : Slimani buteur pour sa dernière|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2016/08/28/portugal-slimani-buteur-pour-sa-derniere-90003.php|website=dzfoot.com|accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref>
===Leicester City=== [[File:Manchester United v Leicester City, September 2016 (13).JPG|left|thumb|Slimani with Leicester City against Manchester United]]
On 31 August 2016, the last day of the [[List of English football transfers summer 2016|2016–17 summer transfer window]] in England, Slimani joined [[Premier League]] champions [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on a five-year contract. The transfer fee paid to Sporting was reported as £28 million, a club record for Leicester.<ref>{{cite web|title=Islam Slimani signs for Leicester City|url=http://www.lcfc.com/news/article/2016-17/islam-slimani-signs-for-leicester-city-3284617.aspx|publisher=Leicester City F.C.|accessdate=31 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Stevens|first1=Samuel|title=Islam Slimani to Leicester City: Premier League champions confirm club-record £28m signing from Sporting Lisbon|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/islam-slimani-to-leicester-city-premier-league-champions-confirm-club-record-28m-signing-from-a7218901.html|accessdate=31 August 2016|work=The Independent|date=31 August 2016}}</ref> Leicester had beaten [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] to sign Slimani.<ref name="Tony Pulis explains why West Brom lost out to Leicester on Islam Slimani">{{cite|title = Tony Pulis explains why West Brom lost out to Leicester on Islam Slimani|url = http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/tony-pulis-explains-west-brom-12961152|work = Birmingham Mail|author = Paul Suart|date = 28 April 2017|accessdate = 12 June 2017}}</ref>
On 14 September, he made his debut for Leicester in the [[UEFA Champions League]] playing 62 minutes in a 3–0 victory over [[Club Brugge KV|Club Brugge]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37331303|title=Club Brugge 0–3 Leicester City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 September 2016|accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> Three days later, he made his Premier League debut in a 3–0 victory over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], scoring his side's first two goals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37325839|title=Leicester City 3–0 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 September 2016|accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> On 27 September, Slimani scored the only goal in Leicester's 1–0 win against Porto in the Champions League group stage after a pass from Algerian national teammate [[Riyad Mahrez]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37475476|title=Leicester City 1–0 Porto|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 September 2016|accessdate=27 September 2016}}</ref> It was his sixth goal with [[Iker Casillas]] in goal in 2016, five of which he netted while with his former club Sporting.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fr.starafrica.com/football/articles/ligue-champions-slimani-crucifie-casillas/|title=Ligue des Champions : Slimani crucifie Casillas|publisher=starafrica|date=28 September 2016|accessdate=28 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2016/09/27/uefa-cl-le-duo-slimani-mahrez-offre-la-victoire-aux-foxes-91814.php|title=UEFA CL : Le duo Slimani-Mahrez offre la victoire aux Foxes|publisher=dzfoot|date=27 September 2016|accessdate=27 September 2016}}</ref>
After this goal, Slimani failed to score until matchday 11 of the [[2016–17 Premier League|Premier League]] against West Bromwich Albion from a pass from Mahrez, although Leicester lost 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37814275|title=Winger Matt Phillips punished a horrendous error by midfielder Danny Drinkwater to score the winner for West Brom at champions Leicester.|publisher=BBC|date=6 November 2016|accessdate=11 December 2016}}</ref> Later, on matchday 13, after entering as a substitute, Slimani scored the equalizer for his team from the penalty spot in the last minute against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38036032|title=Islam Slimani's injury-time penalty rescued a point for Leicester as they came from behind twice against Middlesbrough.|publisher=BBC|date=26 November 2016|accessdate=11 December 2016}}</ref> On matchday 15, Slimani helped the Foxes to win against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] 4–2 after he presented two assists for goalscorers [[Jamie Vardy]] and [[Andy King (footballer, born 1988)|Andy King]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38193109|title=Jamie Vardy scored a hat-trick as Leicester City pulled off a stunning victory over an out-of-sorts Manchester City.|publisher=BBC|date=10 December 2016|accessdate=11 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2016/12/10/angleterre-slimani-double-passeur-en-3-minutes-95736.php|title=Angleterre : Slimani double passeur en 3 minutes !|publisher=dzfoot.com|date=10 December 2016|accessdate=11 December 2016}}</ref> On 31 December, after five games without a goal, Slimani scored the winning goal against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] at the [[King Power Stadium]] to lead his team to win the fifth in the Premier League this season, the last day of 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/leicester-vs-west-ham-match-report-islam-slimani-goal-end-2016-ease-relegation-fears-a7503641.html|title=Islam Slimani gives Foxes a winning end to 2016 to ease relegation fears|work=The Independent|date=31 December 2016|accessdate=31 December 2016}}</ref>
Slimani scored four of his five league goals from headers, but had only managed a 38% shot accuracy by January 2017.<ref name="Leicester's new signings failing to make impact for champions">{{cite|title = Leicester's new signings failing to make impact for champions|url = http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11712/10734910/leicesters-new-signings-failing-to-make-impact-for-champions|publisher = Sky Sports|date = 21 January 2017|accessdate = 23 January 2017}}</ref> After his participation in the African Cup, Slimani returned to the club injured, which affected the rest of his season where he did not participate very much and scored only two goals, against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2017/04/04/angleterre-slimani-retrouve-sa-tete-101611.php|title=Angleterre : Slimani retrouve sa tête|publisher=dzfoot.com|date=4 April 2017|accessdate=3 September 2017}}</ref> and against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2017/04/09/pl-slimani-score-mais-everton-plus-fort-101756.php|title=PL : Slimani score encore, mais Everton plus fort|publisher=dzfoot.com|date=9 April 2017|accessdate=3 September 2017}}</ref> In the [[2017–18 EFL Cup|League Cup]] match against [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]], he scored two goals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/2017/08/22/angleterre-double-de-slimani-en-league-cup-106868.php|title=Angleterre : Doublé de Slimani en League Cup|publisher=dzfoot.com|date=22 August 2017|accessdate=3 September 2017}}</ref>
====Newcastle United (loan)==== On 31 January 2018, Slimani signed for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on loan until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lcfc.com/news/610084/islam-slimani-joins-newcastle-united-on-loan/press-release|title=Islam Slimani Joins Newcastle United on Loan|publisher=Leicester City F.C.|date=31 January 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42889375|title=Newcastle sign Leicester striker Islam Slimani and Sparta Prague keeper Martin Dubravka on loan|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 February 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018}}</ref> A thigh injury prevented him from making his debut for the club, which eventually happened exactly two months after signing, in a 1–0 win over [[Huddersfield Town F.C.|Huddersfield Town]], and he was involved in the build-up for the only goal of the game, scored by [[Ayoze Pérez]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43524304|title=Newcastle 1–0 Huddesfield Town|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 March 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018}}</ref> On 15 April, Slimani was again involved in the build-up for the match winning goal in a 2–1 win over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], after his header was flicked on by Pérez, and into the path of [[Matt Ritchie]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43686474|title=Newcastle 2–1 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 April 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018}}</ref>
On 3 May, Slimani was given a three match ban for violent conduct after an off-the-ball incident with [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]]'s [[Craig Dawson]], effectively ending his season with Newcastle.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43989780|title=Islam Slimani: Newcastle forward given three-game ban|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 May 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018}}</ref>
====Fenerbahçe (loan)==== On August 11, 2018, Slimani joined Süper Lig club [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Leicester Striker Islam Slimani Completes Season-Long Loan Move to Turkish Giants Fenerbahce | publisher = 90min | date = 11 August 2018 | accessdate = 11 August 2018 | url = https://www.90min.com/posts/6141629-leicester-striker-islam-slimani-completes-season-long-loan-move-to-turkish-giants-fenerbahce}}</ref>
==International career== In October 2009, Slimani was called up by [[Abdelhak Benchikha]] for the first time to the [[Algeria A' national football team|Algeria A' National Team]] for a week-long training camp in [[Algiers]].<ref>[http://www.dzfoot.com/news.php?hot_id=5091 EN A' : Nouveau stage pour les joueurs locaux] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110710162025/http://www.dzfoot.com/news.php?hot_id=5091 |date=10 July 2011 }}</ref> In March 2010, Slimani was called up again, this time for a [[2011 African Nations Championship – Qualification|2011 African Nations Championship qualifier]] against [[Libya]] as a replacement for his injured CR Belouizdad teammate [[Youcef Saïbi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/news-6076/en-a-l-algerie-a-prepare-le-match-face-a-la-libye/|title=EN A' : L'Algérie A' prépare le match face à la Libye – Football algérien|date=11 March 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100311015552/http://www.dzfoot.com/news-6076/en-a-l-algerie-a-prepare-le-match-face-a-la-libye/|archivedate=11 March 2010|df=dmy-all}}</ref> However, Slimani did not play in the game as Algeria won 1–0.<ref>[http://www.dzfoot.com/fiche-5040.php Algérie A' 1–0 Libye A'] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100716115437/http://www.dzfoot.com/fiche-5040.php |date=16 July 2010 }}</ref>
In May 2012, Slimani was called up for the first time to the [[Algeria national football team|Algeria national team]] for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] qualifiers against [[Mali national football team|Mali]] and [[Rwanda national football team|Rwanda]], and the return leg of the [[2013 Africa Cup of Nations]] qualifier against [[Gambia national football team|Gambia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzfoot.com/news-11476-e-n-la-liste-des-29-pour-les-matchs-de-la-fin-de-saison.php |title=La liste des 29 pour les matchs de la fin de saison |publisher=DZFoot |date=12 May 2012 |accessdate=14 May 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120514094738/http://www.dzfoot.com/news-11476-e-n-la-liste-des-29-pour-les-matchs-de-la-fin-de-saison.php |archivedate=14 May 2012 |df= }}</ref> On 26 May, he made his debut, coming as a substitute at half-time in a friendly against [[Niger national football team|Niger]].<ref name="gbio" /> A week later, on 2 June, Slimani scored his first international goal for Algeria, netting the third goal in the 4–0 win over [[Rwanda national football team|Rwanda]] in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|2014 FIFA World Cup qualifiers]].<ref name="ig01">{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-india/match/algeria-vs-rwanda/1230229/report|title=Algeria 4–0 Rwanda|publisher=goal.com|date=3 June 2012|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> He followed that up with another goal against Mali in the next game,<ref name="ig2">{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/06/10/africa/wc-qualifying-africa/mali/algeria/1230231/ |title=Mali vs. Algeria – 10 June 201 |publisher=soccerway |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> and then scored another two goals in the following against Gambia.<ref name="ig34">{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ie/match/algeria-vs-gambia/1234245/report |title=Algeria 4 – 1 Gambia Match report |publisher=Goal.com |date=13 July 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
Slimani was selected for Algeria's squad taking part in the 2013 Africa Cup of Nations, and played in all three group games in January.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/islam-slimani/89404/ |title=Algeria – I. Slimani – Profile |publisher=soccerway |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> Algeria, however, only won one point and were eliminated at the first stage.<ref>{{cite web|title=African Cup of Nations: Ivory Coast draw 2–2 with Algeria|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/280038/report|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=21 July 2014|date=30 January 2013}}</ref>
Algeria qualified for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]], with manager [[Vahid Halilhodžić]] selecting Slimani for his 23-man squad.<ref>{{cite web|title=Algeria squad for 2014 World Cup: the 23 chosen by Vahid Halilhodzic|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/06/algeria-squad-world-cup-2014|work=The Guardian|accessdate=21 July 2014|date=6 June 2014}}</ref> On 22 June 2014, Slimani scored the opening goal for ''les Fennecs'' in a 4–2 group match against [[South Korea national football team|South Korea]]. He also made an assist for the team's third goal by passing the ball to [[Abdelmoumene Djabou]].<ref name="wc01">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285249|title=South Korea 2–4 Algeria|date=22 June 2014|accessdate=23 June 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref> On 26 June, Slimani scored with a header in Algeria's 1–1 draw with [[Russia national football team|Russia]], helping the nation qualify for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage|knockout rounds]] of the [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] for the first time ever after failing to do so previously in [[1982 FIFA World Cup|1982]], [[1986 FIFA World Cup|1986]] and 2010.<ref name="wc02">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285498|title=Algeria 1–1 Russia|date=26 June 2014|accessdate=27 June 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref> In the round of 16 match against [[German national football team|Germany]], Slimani had a headed goal disallowed in the first half for [[Offside (association football)|offside]], while later on, his powerful shot at goal was saved by German goalkeeper [[Manuel Neuer]].<ref name="ger14">{{cite web|last1=Omstein|first1=David|title=Germany 2 – 1 Alegria (after extra time)|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27969924|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 July 2014|date=1 July 2014}}</ref> Algeria eventually lost 2–1 after extra time, but were praised for an excellent campaign throughout the tournament.<ref name="ger14" />
In Algeria's opening match of the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]], Slimani scored the final goal in a 3–1 victory over [[South Africa national football team|South Africa]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30773500|title=Algeria 3–1 South Africa|accessdate=24 January 2015|publisher=BBC}}</ref>
